page.title: 02Kimbolton Castle
page.content: The castle has stood on the present site since {Geoffrey Fitzpiers} abandoned the original one,half a mile to the south west, in about 1200. It has undergone a series of rebuilds the most important of which was to the designs of {Vanbrugh and Hawksmoor} between 1707 and 1719. At the same time the Venetian painter{Pellegrini} provided murals over the grand staircase and in the chapel. The last major renovation left the castle much as it stands today : a fortified manor house has evolved into a C18 stately home, and finally been sympathetially adapted into a school. The Manchesters' motto {DISPONENDO NON MUTANDO ME} is inscribed on a stone crest over the courtyard and has multiple ironies.
